name: Torta de Milanesa -- Baked Chicken Cutlet Sandwich with Avocado, Pico de Gallo and Chipotle Mayo
description: Keep some of these breaded chicken cutlets in the freezer and you'll always have the option of making a classic Torta de Milanesa.

recipeInstructions.text: If you are using chicken breasts, start by slicing the breasts in half horizontally.
recipeInstructions.name: If you are using chicken breasts, start by slicing the breasts in half horizontally.

recipeInstructions.text: Place each half between plastic or wax paper and pound them out using a cleaver (or skillet)
recipeInstructions.name: Place each half between plastic or wax paper and pound them out using a cleaver (or skillet)

recipeInstructions.text: Build your Milanesa assembly station using a handful of flour, 2 eggs, and 1.5 cups of breadcrumbs
recipeInstructions.name: Build your Milanesa assembly station using a handful of flour, 2 eggs, and 1.5 cups of breadcrumbs

recipeInstructions.text: If seasoning the breadcrumbs (optional), add a handful of Cotija cheese, 1/2 teaspoon chipotle powder and a generous pinch of salt
recipeInstructions.name: If seasoning the breadcrumbs (optional), add a handful of Cotija cheese, 1/2 teaspoon chipotle powder and a generous pinch of salt

recipeInstructions.text: Dredge each cutlet in flour, egg, and breadcrumbs
recipeInstructions.name: Dredge each cutlet in flour, egg, and breadcrumbs

recipeInstructions.text: Bake the cutlets for 15-20 minutes at 400F or until the chicken is cooked through.  (This batch took about 18 minutes.)
recipeInstructions.name: Bake the cutlets for 15-20 minutes at 400F or until the chicken is cooked through.  (This batch took about 18 minutes.)

recipeInstructions.text: For the chipotle mayonnaise, combine the following ingredients in a blender or food processor: 1/4 cup mayonnaise, 1 chipotle in adobo, 1 garlic clove, a squeeze of lime juice, and a pinch of salt.
recipeInstructions.name: For the chipotle mayonnaise, combine the following ingredients in a blender or food processor: 1/4 cup mayonnaise, 1 chipotle in adobo, 1 garlic clove, a squeeze of lime juice, and a pinch of salt.

recipeInstructions.text: Add a dash of water if the ingredients don't combine readily
recipeInstructions.name: Add a dash of water if the ingredients don't combine readily

recipeInstructions.text: For the Pico de Gallo, finely chop 1 Roma tomato, 1/4 onion, 1/2 jalapeno, and 10 sprigs of cilantro.
recipeInstructions.name: For the Pico de Gallo, finely chop 1 Roma tomato, 1/4 onion, 1/2 jalapeno, and 10 sprigs of cilantro.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix well and add the juice of half a lime and a pinch of salt
recipeInstructions.name: Mix well and add the juice of half a lime and a pinch of salt

recipeInstructions.text: Slice an avocado into thin strips for the sandwiches
recipeInstructions.name: Slice an avocado into thin strips for the sandwiches

recipeInstructions.text: Each Milanesa de Torta gets a chicken cutlet (or two!), avocado, Pico de Gallo and chipotle mayonnaise.
recipeInstructions.name: Each Milanesa de Torta gets a chicken cutlet (or two!), avocado, Pico de Gallo and chipotle mayonnaise.
